channel.title: Status on Srikanth Perinkulam
channel.description: Recent content in Status on Srikanth Perinkulam

item.title: 2025-Feb-23
item.description:
Trying to implement something similar to DayOne. Essentially a place where I can dive in and jot quick notes for that day - not having to worry about frontmatter, templates etc.

I might have to do some minor tweaks on how images are displayed here similar to the photos page…

M went over to the Jewish neighborhood in Centro Historico for the Post Language Program trip. S & I stayed back. Got some paperwork done for our visas. Walked over to El JardÃ­n EscÃ©nico on Reforma and from there head over to Ehden Restaurant to meet the PLP group there. Some decent Lebanese food, a delicious date cake and a TERRIFIC arabic coffee!

item.title: 2025-Feb-22
item.description: Tinkered a bit with my Matrix installation. Upgrade went smooth but I wasn’t able to backfill my messages in Element. Looks like the rooms get added back in only when some new message comes in. No biggie…

item.title: 2025-Feb-20
item.description: The packers came in today and boxed up most of our belongings. We’d already sorted stuff pretty decently, so they barely needed our intervention. Another team should come in tomorrow to load these out.

item.title: Time
item.description:
We’ve got barely two weeks left here in CDMX! As with any move, we’ve been trimming our holdings down. Still amazed that I can fit almost all of my vital belongings into two 50 lbs suitcases. As a family our holdings weighed about 3000 lbs in total when we moved to Mexico city. Pretty sure we should be in that ball-park for this move too.

Made the tough call NOT to hike Orizaba the coming weekend. I think I just didn’t have the mind space to plan it all out.

Decided to let go of the 3D Printer I bought from a colleague last year. I haven’t had much time to tinker with it and it just sank in, I’ll probably have a tough time getting the supplies shipped over to Yaounde. Some indulgences - invested or not - are probably just worth letting go!

Tweaked my comments code to send notifications to my NTFY channel when this site receives spam - just for kicks. And boy, it does seem to work. ðŸ”—

item.title: Millebornes
item.description: We borrowed Millebornes from the Hancocks couple days ago since S has totally gotten into it now. The one we owned mysteriously went missing when we PCSâ€™d to CDMX last year. Time to order a few more boxes of this and Monopoly Deal!

item.title: Moving
item.description:
So thrilled to be back home in CDMX. The last four weeks have been draining to say the least. Being away from the family and having to eat outside every single day was a bit of a stretch.

On the work front, each day of the last four weeks has been nothing but a regular TDY day on steroids. Was absolutely exciting to work through the never ending â€˜surprisesâ€™ and finding ways to make things work with what was thrown at us. Decommissioning the existing consulate and commissioning the new one in Hermosillo has been a huge learning experience. I need to feed all that Iâ€™ve gleaned in Hermosillo into Meridaâ€™s upcoming move.

For now, Iâ€™m so looking forward to a relatively slow next couple weeks. Never thought the mundane would be so exciting!

item.title: StirlingPDF
item.description: Absolutely floored by StirlingPDF. Installing it barely took 3 minutes and itâ€™s got features that will give Adobe a run for its money!

item.title: projects
item.description: The pains and joys of self-hosting and tinkering. Thereâ€™s always something that is broken, ready to be fixed, to be upgraded, can be built upon or changed. It is like a puzzle that constantly evolves depending on the time you invest in it. And every once in a while it exposes the silver lining that keeps you hooked to it.

item.title: PhotoPrism Albums
item.description: M and I tend to share photos with family and friends on various chat groups. While straightforward, It felt redundant to share copies of the same pictures in multiple places. Iâ€™ve been looking for options to share album links instead that would give us a bit more control. All our photos are primarily saved in a Nextcloud self-hosted instance. I explored a few options of album shares there but wasnâ€™t quite happy. Pixelfed was another option I explored. It did check most of the requirements but I wasnâ€™t quite comfortable relying on a software thatâ€™s mostly dependent on just one developer. Also the unlisted feature on their albums seemed half-baked and not yet ready for prime-time. Finally played a bit with PhotoPrism and so far it seems to be something that checks all the boxes. With private links, a PWA app and great thumbnails this might be the closest solution for my photo needs.

item.title: JMP
item.description: Been looking for a Google voice number replacement for sometime now and looks like I might have found one that meets most of my needs. Just got a JMP number and ordered a sim with a data plan. The cheogram app so far has been great and once I get the SIM I might slowly transition things out of GV.

item.title: Tasmota
item.description: Wanting to have more control on the Digital Photo Frame that I setup a few days ago, I ordered a few Sonoff smart plugs. Right after I ordered them I realised I could actually flash Tasmota on them to keep them cloud-free. Ordered a couple FTDI USB adapters to flash Tasmota on them. Time to dust off that soldering gun!

item.title: Grand Vitara
item.description:
Brought the Grand Vitara home today. Weâ€™d been on the lookout for a decent car ever since we knew about our next posting. We donâ€™t need one here in CDMX but would definitely need one in Yaounde. All I wanted was a reliable bare minimum car with no gadgetry shabangs. Over the last few months folks on their PCS did post a few decent cars but these are barely in the market for a few hours. With this one though, the stars seemed to align all well one day and we were able to seal the deal in a few hours.

Given the mileage, the GV might need some maintenance over the next few years. It rides like butter now though and reminds me of the Grand Cherokee we had in NYC/BOS.

item.title: BMG
item.description: Went to a Blue Man Group performance last Friday. Our first and most likely last. The drums were great but the theatrics left a lot to be desired. Also didnâ€™t help that S was in one of her super emotional moodsâ€¦

item.title: Digital Photo frame
item.description: Used the spare RPI3 I salvaged from the NCP migration and made a decent digital photo frame. Ever since I consolidated all my photos, Iâ€™ve been wanting to setup a digital frame that would take us back in time on command. Some version of â€˜On this dayâ€™ â€“ but for photos. I think I have a solution that is close to what I had in mind. The photos are currently on a USB drive synced from my Nextcloud server via a cron job. I still need to work out how I choose what photos get displayed when. But so far, I am pretty happy with how this has turned out.
